name: Backstage
description: Backstage is Spotify’s open platform for building developer portals. It centralizes tools and services into a streamlined interface.

name: Event-Driven Architecture
description: Spotify extensively uses event-driven architecture for loosely coupled services and better scalability.

name: Tingle (Test Orchestration)
description: Tingle is an internal tool developed by Spotify to orchestrate automated test pipelines across microservices.

name: Protocol Buffers
description: Spotify uses Protocol Buffers (Protobuf) as a language-neutral, platform-neutral extensible mechanism for serializing structured data.

name: Terraform
description: Spotify uses Terraform to provision and manage cloud infrastructure reliably and at scale.

name: Golang
description: Spotify has begun introducing Golang into performance-critical microservices where concurrency and speed matter.

name: Helios (Container Debugging Tool)
description: Helios is Spotify's tool for debugging containers in Kubernetes environments with real-time data visibility.

name: Apache Beam
description: Although Beam provides a unified programming model for batch and streaming, Spotify has shifted focus toward simpler managed alternatives.
